docs.abstract: Virtual helpers that come with female voices by default are perpetuating bias, a Unesco report argues.
docs.snippet: Virtual helpers that come with female voices by default are perpetuating bias, a Unesco report argues.
docs.lead_paragraph: Why do most virtual assistants that are powered by artificial intelligence — like Apple’s Siri and Amazon’s Alexa system — by default have female names, female voices and often a submissive or even flirtatious style?

headline.main: Siri and Alexa Reinforce Gender Bias, U.N. Finds
headline.print_headline: Siri and Alexa Contribute To Sexism, Unesco Finds

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization

headline.print_headline: Putting the Tech Genie Back in the Bottle

docs.abstract: The “Break Up Big Tech” billboard, paid for by the Democrat’s presidential campaign, doesn’t sit well with all San Franciscans who work in the industry.
docs.snippet: The “Break Up Big Tech” billboard, paid for by the Democrat’s presidential campaign, doesn’t sit well with all San Franciscans who work in the industry.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — A threat of government regulation is casting a shadow over the tech industry. Now there is a billboard to remind tech workers about it on their commutes.

headline.main: Elizabeth Warren Sticks Her Message in Big Tech’s Face

docs.abstract: Intense new scrutiny on companies like Google, Apple, Facebook and Amazon could last years and lead to the first overhaul of antitrust rules in decades.
docs.snippet: Intense new scrutiny on companies like Google, Apple, Facebook and Amazon could last years and lead to the first overhaul of antitrust rules in decades.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The federal government is stepping up its scrutiny of the world’s biggest tech companies, leaving them vulnerable to new rules and federal lawsuits. Regulators are divvying up antitrust oversight of the Silicon Valley giants and lawmakers are investigating whether they have stifled competition and hurt consumers.

headline.main: Antitrust Troubles Snowball for Tech Giants as Lawmakers Join In
headline.print_headline: Tech Titans Face Tough Scrutiny From All Sides

byline.original: By Cecilia Kang, David Streitfeld and Annie Karni

docs.abstract: The legal action against Silicon Valley’s giants will be long, difficult, uncertain and, for some people, disappointing.
docs.snippet: The legal action against Silicon Valley’s giants will be long, difficult, uncertain and, for some people, disappointing.

headline.print_headline: A Big Tech Breakup? Don’t Count On It

docs.abstract: Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google, facing the growing possibility of antitrust action and legislation to rein in their power, are spending freely to gain influence and access.
docs.snippet: Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google, facing the growing possibility of antitrust action and legislation to rein in their power, are spending freely to gain influence and access.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Faced with the growing possibility of antitrust actions and legislation to curb their power, four of the biggest technology companies are amassing an army of lobbyists as they prepare for what could be an epic fight over their futures.

headline.main: Tech Giants Amass a Lobbying Army for an Epic Washington Battle
headline.print_headline: Tech Titans Build Lobbyist Army,  Trying to Repel Threats to Power

byline.original: By Cecilia Kang and Kenneth P. Vogel

docs.abstract: Apple’s software changed the way we listen to music. And though it got a little bloated over the years, we will miss it.
docs.snippet: Apple’s software changed the way we listen to music. And though it got a little bloated over the years, we will miss it.

headline.print_headline: ITunes, ‘Digital Jukebox’ By Apple, Is Dead at 18

docs.abstract: New versions of the Apple and Google operating systems are packed with hundreds of new features. Here are the few you should know about.
docs.snippet: New versions of the Apple and Google operating systems are packed with hundreds of new features. Here are the few you should know about.
docs.lead_paragraph: Year after year, Apple and Google announce big upgrades for their smartphone operating systems. That means the software that makes your phone tick is about to change — again.

headline.main: How Updates in iOS 13 and Android Q Will Change Your Smartphone
headline.print_headline: Time to Get Reacquainted With Your Phone

docs.abstract: Could Facebook, Google or Apple be considered monopolies? Increased government oversight of the technology giants could consider that possibility.

headline.main: The U.S. Has Its Eye on Big Tech. Will Criminal Inquiries Result?

docs.abstract: A new documentary offers an in-depth look at a company that envisioned technologies like iPhones, emojis and touch screens long before they arrived.
docs.snippet: A new documentary offers an in-depth look at a company that envisioned technologies like iPhones, emojis and touch screens long before they arrived.
docs.lead_paragraph: What happens when you invent a future that remains, resolutely, in the future? Sarah Kerruish and Matt Maude’s documentary “General Magic” looks at a Silicon Valley startup that in the early 1990s accurately imagined the world we’d be living in today. The developers, designers and engineers at General Magic worked on concepts like e-commerce, touch screens, animated emoticons and, most notably, a smartphone that would contain the world.

headline.main: ‘General Magic’ Review: A Startup Before Its Time
